alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Okaloosa and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 246 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen and additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible over the area. This, along with already saturated soils from recent rains, will lead to minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parkerville, Harper, Broxson, Holley and Pine Bluff. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
